body_html: @jolinxql According to the post here, It seems that it is not consistent when you load dumps from a newer version in a old version of Pickle. Would you please try whether it is okay when the two PCs share the same Python version? The CRLF/LF issue should not exist, since the pickle file is opened with the mode rb and wb.
body_text: @jolinxql According to the post here, It seems that it is not consistent when you load dumps from a newer version in a old version of Pickle. Would you please try whether it is okay when the two PCs share the same Python version? The CRLF/LF issue should not exist, since the pickle file is opened with the mode rb and wb.
body: @jolinxql According to the post [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1849523/is-pickle-file-of-python-cross-platform), It seems that it is not consistent when you load dumps from a newer version in a old version of Pickle. Would you please try whether it is okay when the two PCs share the same Python version? The CRLF/LF issue should not exist, since the pickle file is opened with the mode `rb` and `wb`.
